statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ -4 \\ -4 \\ -3 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 1 \\ -1 \\ -2 \\ -4 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ 0 \\ 2 \\ 1 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ 3 \\ -5 \\ -4 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -6 \\ 3 \\ -1 \\ -6 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] are linearly dependent or linearly independent.

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ -4 \\ -4 \\ -3 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 1 \\ -1 \\ -2 \\ -4 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ 0 \\ 2 \\ 1 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ 3 \\ -5 \\ -4 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -6 \\ 3 \\ -1 \\ -6 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] are linearly independent .
